title: Ticket #7102: schedd crashed on ARM due to clone's stack alignment
description:
Steffen from AEI reports that a remote condor_history query consistently crashes the schedd. Stack trace shows it is in the clone_fn call. Setting USE_CLONE_TO_EXEC_PROCESSES = false makes the crash stop.

Documentation reveals that on ARM (and perhaps other architectures?) the stack passed to clone has to be 16 byte aligned. It won't hurt, and will probably help a bit do this these on all architectures.
remarks:
2019-Jul-08 11:34:12 by jfrey:
Code Review

When you calculate child_stack_ptr, you need to include the extra 16 bytes in your array indexing. Otherwise, after masking out the lowest four bits in the address, the top end of the stack (lowest address) can end up outside of the declared array.

You only need 15 bytes of padding, not that having 16 hurts.

2019-Jul-09 16:27:38 by jfrey:
Code Review

The change looks good.
